channel.title: Force DRM removal?
channel.description: I have a copy of "Percy Jackson and the Olympians", but I had to go into the Digital Copy disc to get the WMV files due to it already being activated from when my computer took a shit. Is there any way that I can force remove the DRM from these files? I have the serial, but I cant find a program that can use that number and remove it successfully.

item.title: Force DRM removal?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:9, topic:440540”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=543219.msg3981761#msg3981761 date=1335367856]

I find that simply converting the video to a different format can get rid of it, depends on the type of DRM though.

Alright thanks I’ll try that. Any recommended tools?

google.com
[/quote]
I know that lol, I just figured a recommended would make for a better result. Either way it still failed to play after it converted.[/quote]
Give switch audio converter a try? I’ve found it to be one of the best, use the pro version trial. If that fails there’s no harm in trying Adobe Soundbooth and exporting it to a different format, wouldn’t hurt to try audacity too.

Read full topic

item.title: Force DRM removal?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

SilentCJ:

I find that simply converting the video to a different format can get rid of it, depends on the type of DRM though.

assuming the encoder can read the data in the file (which is encrypted using DRM)

Read full topic

item.title: Force DRM removal?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:8, topic:440540”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=543219.msg3981757#msg3981757 date=1335367384]

I find that simply converting the video to a different format can get rid of it, depends on the type of DRM though.

Alright thanks I’ll try that. Any recommended tools?
[/quote]
google.com :|[/quote]
I know that lol, I just figured a recommended would make for a better result. Either way it still failed to play after it converted.

Read full topic

item.title: Force DRM removal?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

t4:

so you’ve got an encrypted iso (encrypted by DRM)?

WMV files, not ISO. There is a disc that can transfer the digital copy to your PC via itunes or windows media player. It told me my serial was already activated so I went into the files of the disc and took the WMV file out that way. The issue is now I am stuck with a WMV file that cannot be played, and a non-working DVD lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Force DRM removal?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

t4:

wat. where did you but this from?

Got it from Walmart back when it came out. The DVD stopped working so I thought “Ill use the digital copy and just burn another”, but it seems to be proving wrong with the DRM protection on it.

Read full topic
